info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 19 at 8:41AM CDT until May 24 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri...Kansas...
Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County.
Little Osage River at Fulton affecting Bourbon County.
Marmaton River at Fort Scott affecting Bourbon County.
Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County.
For the Little Osage River...including Fulton, Horton...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Marmaton River...including Fort Scott, Nevada...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Little Osage River near Horton.
* WHEN...From late tonight to early Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 45.0 feet, moderate flooding occurs at the gage site. Low lying areas along Route D near Stotesbury flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CDT Monday the stage was 32.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 41.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 44.4 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 41.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 44.4 feet on 04/30/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 845 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING
